title.narrative: IMPROVED CAPACITIES AND MECHANISMS FOR IMPLEMENTING LOCAL PUBLIC POLICIES

description.narrative: Institutions responsible for comprehensive attention to children and adolescents have developed capacities to respond adequately to the needs of children and adolescents and their families and pregnant and breastfeeding women as well as the needs of communities with regard to health, nutrition and social, environmental and sanitary emergencies as well as Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and child and adolescent development, which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Institutions responsible for comprehensive attention to children and adolescents have developed capacities to respond adequately to the needs of children and adolescents and their families and pregnant and breastfeeding women as well as the needs of communities with regard to health, nutrition and social, environmental and sanitary emergencies as well as WASH and child and adolescent development

description.narrative:
The municipalities prioritized both in the peacebuilding agenda and in UNICEF’s program improved their capacities to guarantee children’s rights, particularly the family welfare territorial system (Social Policy Councils and Children and Adolescents’ Working Groups). UNICEF Colombia formed local teams to design projects to prevent violence, promote access to basic health and education services, strengthen local working groups for children, and implement initiatives emphasizing peacebuilding. In the context of the Child-Friendly Territories Strategy, UNICEF Colombia transferred tools offering guidance on ‘what needs to be done’ and monitoring actions and optimizing technical and financial resources to prioritize children and adolescents.

| Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2022
